data.name: Square root of a Double
data.description:
Write a function:

```haskell
estimateSqrt :: Double -> Double
```
which calculates the square root of any positive ```x :: Double``` to a first approximation

In the tests, ```x``` will always be greater than zero, but may be very large or very small.

Your results should be accurate to within 10%, so they will be checked by a function something like this:

```haskell
checkSqrt :: Double -> Bool
checkSqrt x = y <= 1.21 && y >= (recip 1.21)
              where y = x / (estimateSqrt x)^2
```
The functions ```sqrt``` ```log``` ```exp``` ```sin``` ```cos``` and ```(**)``` have been hidden.

Don't worry, there are still some functions in ```Prelude``` which can help you.
